intro: Carex praecox var. dumetorum, commonly known as the early sedge, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. The plant features grass-like leaves that are often dark green and arranged in dense clusters. Its flowers are small and clustered in spikelets, which are typically wind-pollinated. It plays an important ecological role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various invertebrates.
